entries.title: US Supreme Court rules to keep pandemic-era immigration limits in place indefinitely
entries.description: In a ruling Tuesday, December 27, 2022, the Supreme Court extended the limits put in place under then-president Donald Trump expelling and turning away most asylum seekers.

entries.title: Italy allows Ocean Viking to dock carrying 113 rescued migrants
entries.description: The rescue ship was at the heart of a standoff between France and Italy in November, when Rome refused to allow it to dock.

entries.title: Iranian man commits suicide in France to denounce regime's repression
entries.description: The man jumped into the Rhone river, in Lyon, after posting a video saying he would drown himself to highlight the crackdown on protesters in Iran.

entries.title: 'Iranian women's demands belong to the ideological enemy: the West'
entries.description: The protests that have shaken Iran since the death of Mahsa Amini, on September 16, illustrate a rupture between those born in the 2000s and the country's theocratic elites.

entries.title: Syria paralyzed by fuel shortages
entries.description: 'This is the worst crisis the country has ever experienced': After 11 years of war and international sanctions, the state's coffers are empty.

entries.title: Russia to ban oil exports to countries with price cap from February
entries.description: A decree will be in effect from February 1, 2023, and is expected to last five months.

entries.title: 'Emmanuel Macron must do everything possible to guarantee the security of Armenians in Nagorno-Karabakh and the Republic of Armenia'
entries.description: Eleven French lawmakers and political leaders sign a transpartisan letter urging President Emmanuel Macron to intervene to 'prevent irreparable damage' and ensure the safety of Armenians in Nagorno-Karabakh.

entries.title: Kosovo: Serbs put up new roadblocks as tensions soar
entries.description: Serbia's president said the army is ready to 'protect' Serbs in Kosovo, claiming they were at risk of being attacked.

entries.title: Twitter: 'Elon Musk poses as a superhero, when he is ultimately just a pyromaniac fireman'
entries.description: Developing autonomous cars or satellite launchers is ultimately easier than trying to assume the role of a champion of free speech, as the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX wanted to do for the social media platform, argues 'Le Monde' columnist Stéphane Lauer.

entries.title: Return of convicted MP divides left-wing La France Insoumise
entries.description: The party is torn between those who defend Adrien Quatennens and those in favor of his exclusion.

entries.title: India orders PCR tests for most Asian travelers
entries.description: The decision comes in response to the Covid-19 outbreak in China. As it chairs G20 for a year, New Delhi is seeking to avoid another health crisis.

entries.title: Chinese expats race to buy fever and headache medicine to treat Covid-19
entries.description: In Japan, Taiwan and Singapore, a massive rush to buy over-the-counter drugs to send back to families in China is causing a risk of shortages.

entries.title: Japan demands Covid-19 tests for all visitors from China
entries.description: The Japanese prime minister announced new border controls as severe cases rise in China.

entries.title: Elon Musk's Starlink constellation may well destabilize the world of telecom
entries.description: 'Race to the Stars' (2/4). Starlink's promise of fast internet access everywhere on the planet poses a threat to telecom operators. Though they stay quiet, their radars have spotted the rockets, and some shots have already been fired.

entries.title: China re-opens to the world despite Covid surge
entries.description: As of January 8, 2023, people entering the country will no longer have to undergo multiple tests or quarantine, as had been the policy since March 2020.

entries.title: Speaking the truth about immigration
entries.description: After reducing the number of visas granted to Algerian, Moroccan and Tunisian nationals one year ago, France has just reversed this decision with little explanation. The about-face shows that simple solutions are not adequate for managing migration flows but are too often put forward to soothe public opinion.

entries.title: Immigration: New residence permits for medical professions will have limited impact
entries.description: The French government's immigration bill will grant a residence permit for a maximum of four years to doctors who have graduated outside the European Union. Professionals are unconvinced.

entries.title: 'Starlinkians', the fans ready to turn a blind eye to Elon Musk's slip-ups
entries.description: Like with Tesla, the founder of the Starlink satellite constellation has the support of a community of followers who have been won over by the service.

entries.title: Taiwan extends duration of mandatory military service over China threat
entries.description: Mandatory service will be extended from four months to one year.

entries.title: Kurds killed in Paris: Suspect charged, Kurdish community marches to demand 'justice'
entries.description: William M. was charged with murder and attempted murder, with racism as an aggravating circumstance. The Kurdish community is calling it an 'act of terrorism.'

entries.title: Paris shooting: Did the police treat the suspect's previous case too lightly?
entries.description: On December 8, 2021, William M. attacked a migrant camp in Bercy park in Paris. The police and the prosecutor's office seem to have underestimated the dangerousness of the attacker, who was released on parole on December 12.

entries.title: Nutri-Score labeling system to be updated next year
entries.description: The governance committee of the nutritional logo has approved several changes to its algorithm expected to be effective in 2023.

entries.title: Emine Kara, Mir Perwer and Abdurrahman Kizil: The three new 'martyrs' of the Kurdish cause
entries.description: One of the three people killed in a Paris shooting was a heroine of the Kurdish national movement who had fought against the Islamic State organization. The others were a young musician and a pensioner.

entries.title: Danish discount retailer 'Normal' thrives in France
entries.description: Buoyed by inflation, the retail chain has opened 80 stores in France in three years and intends to seize market share from its Dutch competitor, Action.

entries.title: The battle over Europe's nutrition label
entries.description: The European Commission was expected to propose a harmonized logo before the end of the year, but the presentation was postponed due to a revolt led by Italy.

entries.title: The perpetual resilience of movie theaters
entries.description: The drop in the number of moviegoers France experienced at the beginning of fall has been improving towards the end of the year. Yet, many constraints still weigh on the future of movie theaters, which have always been able to innovate and adapt to the circumstances.
